nodes.documentation:
@author Karen Suen
@notice A contract for managing trading of funds between buyers and sellers.
This contract manages all transactions between buyers and sellers in the
marketplace. When a buyer commits to purchasing a listing, a new transaction
is created and buyer's purchase funds are held in this Escrow contract until
the buyer confirms successful delivery of the item from seller. New transactions
are started by creating a new Transaction struct and storing it in the map.
Only 1 transaction per listing can be maintained at a time. Minimal safety
checks are implemented here to avoid double payments or completing trades
before payment is actually received in escrow.
nodes.name: Escrow

nodes.documentation:
@notice Throws error if transaction is not in AWAITING_PAYMENT status
@param _id Transaction id
nodes.name: isAwaitingPayment

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Transaction is not awaiting item delivery"

arguments.value: Transaction is not awaiting item delivery

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Transaction is not awaiting item delivery"

@notice Throws error if transaction is not in AWAITING_DELIVERY status
@param _id Transaction id
nodes.name: isAwaitingDelivery
startTransaction
fundTransaction
confirmItemReceived
getTransaction
getAllUserTransactions
getTransactionBuyer
getTransactionSeller
getTransactionAmount
getTransactionStatus

nodes.documentation:
@dev release payment to seller by transferring correct amount of funds
from escrow contract.
nodes.name: _releaseFundsToBuyer

This contract manages all transactions between buyers and sellers in the
marketplace. When a buyer commits to purchasing a listing, a new transaction

nodes.documentation:
@notice Throws error if transaction is not in AWAITING_DELIVERY status
@param _id Transaction id
nodes.name: isAwaitingDelivery
startTransaction
fundTransaction
confirmItemReceived
getTransaction
getAllUserTransactions
getTransactionBuyer
getTransactionSeller
getTransactionAmount
getTransactionStatus

nodes.documentation:
@dev release payment to seller by transferring correct amount of funds
from escrow contract.
nodes.name: _releaseFundsToBuyer

confirmItemReceived(uint256).details: Buyer confirms delivery of item from seller and escrow funds held in this transaction is released to the seller. The transaction must be in the correct state (AWAITING_DELIVERY) to be confirmed

params._id: Transaction id to confirm and release funds

fundTransaction(uint256).details: Receives and holds buyer's funds for purchasing a listing and updates the state of the corresponding transaction.

getAllUserTransactions(address).details: Return the list of all transaction ids involving the given account

params._user: The account address to retrieve all transactions for

getTransaction(uint256).details: Returns all information about a transaction as a tuple
getTransaction(uint256).return: Transaction status, buyer address, seller address, transaction amount in Wei

getTransactionAmount(uint256).details: Return the agreed amount of the given transaction id

params._id: Transaction id to retrieve the agreed amount

getTransactionBuyer(uint256).details: Return the buyer address of given transaction id

params._id: Transaction id to retrieve buyer address of

getTransactionSeller(uint256).details: Return the seller address of given transaction id

params._id: Transaction id to retrieve seller address of

getTransactionStatus(uint256).details: Return the current status of the given transaction id

params._id: Transaction id to retrieve status of return Transaction status

startTransaction(uint256,address,address.details: Create a new transaction for the given listing, new transactions always starts in AWAITING_PAYMENT.

params._buyer: The buyer address of the listing
params._id: The listing id that will be used for this transaction's id
params._seller: The seller address that created the listing

userdoc.notice: A contract for managing trading of funds between buyers and sellers. This contract manages all transactions between buyers and sellers in the marketplace. When a buyer commits to purchasing a listing, a new transaction is created and buyer's purchase funds are held in this Escrow contract until the buyer confirms successful delivery of the item from seller. New transactions are started by creating a new Transaction struct and storing it in the map. Only 1 transaction per listing can be maintained at a time. Minimal safety checks are implemented here to avoid double payments or completing trades before payment is actually received in escrow.
